greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: (1/2) * number of ways to select 3 distinct points forming a triangle of unsigned area = 1 from a rectangle of grid points with side lengths j and k, written as triangle T(j,k), j<=k.
example: a(2) = T(1,2) = 3 = 6/2 because the following 6 triangles of area 1 can be made by selecting 3 grid points from the [0,1]X[0,2] rectangle:
